definitions.definition: To write a first version ; to make a preliminary sketch .
To draw in outline ; to make a draught , sketch , or plan of, as in architectural and mechanical drawing.
To select (someone or something) for a particular role or purpose .
examples: There was a campaign to draft Smith to run for President.
They drafted me to be the chairperson of the new committee.

subdefinitions.definition: To conscript (a person ); to force (a person) to serve in some capacity, especially in the military .
examples: He was drafted during the Vietnam War.

subdefinitions.definition: To select and separate an animal or animals from a group .
examples: The calves were drafted from the cows.

subdefinitions.definition: To select a rookie player onto a professional sports team .
examples: After his last year of college football, he was drafted by the Miami Dolphins.

definitions.definition: To follow very closely (behind another vehicle ), thereby providing an aerodynamic advantage to both lead and follower and conserving energy or increasing speed .
To draw out ; to call forth .
To draw fibers out of a clump , for spinning in the production of yarn .
To play a collectible card game by selecting from a shared pool of cards.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To write a first version ; to make a preliminary sketch .
secondary_definitions: To draw in outline ; to make a draught , sketch , or plan of, as in architectural and mechanical drawing.
To select (someone or something) for a particular role or purpose .
( ambitransitive ) To follow very closely (behind another vehicle ), thereby providing an aerodynamic advantage to both lead and follower and conserving energy or increasing speed .
To draw out ; to call forth .
To draw fibers out of a clump , for spinning in the production of yarn .
( gaming ) To play a collectible card game by selecting from a shared pool of cards.
